intro: Kuhitangia knorringiana, commonly known as the Kuhitangia tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of stipules, which are small leaf-like structures at the base of the leaves. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the plant is adapted to coastal and tropical environments.
